intro: Gnaphalium tenuifolium, commonly known as slenderleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to regions of North America, particularly in the western United States and parts of Canada. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It produces tiny, wind-dispersed seeds that allow it to colonize open areas such as meadows and disturbed soils. Gnaphalium tenuifolium is often used in floral arrangements due to its long-lasting flowers and delicate appearance.
